info.title: CdnManagementClient
info.description: Use these APIs to manage Azure CDN resources through the Azure Resource Manager. You must make sure that requests made to these resources are secure. For more information, see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn790557.aspx.

get.description: Lists the CDN profiles within an Azure subscription.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists the CDN profiles within a resource group.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets a CDN profile with the specified parameters.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates a new CDN profile with the specified parameters.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.
Profile properties needed for creation.
parameters.name: profile

202.description: Accepted and  the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates an existing CDN profile with the specified parameters.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

parameters.name: profileUpdateParameters
parameters.description: Profile properties needed for update.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes an existing CDN profile with the specified parameters. Deleting a profile will result in the deletion of all subresources including endpoints, origins and custom domains.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Generates a dynamic SSO URI used to sign in to the CDN Supplemental Portal used for advanced management tasks, such as Country Filtering, Advanced HTTP Reports, and Real-time Stats and Alerts. The SSO URI changes approximately every 10 minutes.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists existing CDN endpoints within a profile.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: endpointName
parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: profileName

parameters.name: endpointName
parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile.

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: Endpoint properties

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates an existing CDN endpoint with the specified parameters. Only tags and OriginHostHeader can be updated after creating an endpoint. To update origins, use the Update Origin operation. To update custom domains, use the Update Custom Domain operation.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

parameters.name: endpointName
parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile.

parameters.name: endpointUpdateProperties
parameters.description: Endpoint update properties

202.description: Accepted and  the operation will complete asynchronously

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed

delete.description: Deletes an existing CDN endpoint with the specified parameters.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

parameters.name: endpointName
parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Starts an existing stopped CDN endpoint.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

parameters.name: endpointName
parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Stops an existing running CDN endpoint.

parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile.

parameters.name: contentFilePaths
parameters.description: The path to the content to be purged. Path can describe a file or directory.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

parameters.description: The path to the content to be loaded. Path should describe a file.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Validates a custom domain mapping to ensure it maps to the correct CNAME in DNS.

parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

parameters.name: endpointName

parameters.name: endpointName
parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile.

parameters.name: originName
parameters.description: Name of the origin, an arbitrary value but it needs to be unique under endpoint

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates an existing CDN origin within an endpoint.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile within the resource group.

parameters.name: endpointName
parameters.description: Name of the endpoint within the CDN profile.

parameters.name: originName
parameters.description: Name of the origin. Must be unique within endpoint.

parameters.name: originUpdateProperties
parameters.description: Origin properties

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Check the availability of a resource name without creating the resource. This is needed for resources where name is globally unique, such as a CDN endpoint.

parameters.name: checkNameAvailabilityInput
parameters.description: Input to check.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all of the available CDN REST API operations.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

Profile.description: CDN profile represents the top level resource and the entry point into the CDN API. This allows users to set up a logical grouping of endpoints in addition to creating shared configuration settings and selecting pricing tiers and providers.

sku.description: The SKU (pricing tier) of the CDN profile.

value.description: List of CDN profiles within a resource group.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

ProfileUpdateParameters.description: Profile properties required for profile update.

SsoUri.description: SSO URI required to login to third party web portal.

ssoUriValue.description: The URI used to login to third party web portal.

Endpoint.description: CDN endpoint is the entity within a CDN profile containing configuration information regarding caching behaviors and origins. The CDN endpoint is exposed using the URL format <endpointname>.azureedge.net by default, but custom domains can also be created.

hostName.description: The host name of the endpoint {endpointName}.{DNSZone}

origins.description: The set of origins for the CDN endpoint. When multiple origins exist, the first origin will be used as primary and rest will be used as failover options.

value.description: List of CDN endpoints within a profile

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

EndpointUpdateParameters.description: Endpoint properties required for new endpoint creation.

originHostHeader.description: The host header the CDN provider will send along with content requests to origins. The default value is the host name of the origin.

originPath.description: The path used for origin requests.

contentTypesToCompress.description: List of content types on which compression will be applied. The value for the elements should be a valid MIME type.

isCompressionEnabled.description: Indicates whether content compression is enabled. Default value is false. If compression is enabled, the content transferred from the CDN endpoint to the end user will be compressed. The requested content must be larger than 1 byte and smaller than 1 MB.

isHttpAllowed.description: Indicates whether HTTP traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) must be allowed.

isHttpsAllowed.description: Indicates whether HTTPS traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) must be allowed.

queryStringCachingBehavior.description: Defines the query string caching behavior

geoFilters.description: The list of geo filters for the CDN endpoint.

DeepCreatedOrigin.description: Deep created origins within a CDN endpoint.

DeepCreatedOriginProperties.description: Properties of deep created origin on a CDN endpoint.

hostName.description: The address of the origin. Domain names, IPv4 addresses, and IPv6 addresses are supported.

httpPort.description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535

httpsPort.description: The value of the HTTPS port. Must be between 1 and 65535

GeoFilter.description: Geo filter of a CDN endpoint.

relativePath.description: Relative path applicable to geo filter. (e.g. '/mypictures', '/mypicture/kitty.jpg', and etc.)

countryCodes.description: Two letter country codes of the geo filter. (e.g. AU, MX, and etc.)

contentPaths.description: The path to the content to be purged. Can describe a file path or a wild card directory.
The path to the content to be loaded. Should describe a file path.

Origin.description: CDN origin is the source of the content being delivered via CDN. When the edge nodes represented by an endpoint do not have the requested content cached, they attempt to fetch it from one or more of the configured origins.

hostName.description: The address of the origin. Domain names, IPv4 addresses, and IPv6 addresses are supported.

httpPort.description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.description: The value of the https port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

OriginUpdateParameters.description: Origin properties needed for origin creation or update.

hostName.description: The address of the origin. Domain names, IPv4 addresses, and IPv6 addresses are supported.

httpPort.description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.description: The value of the HTTPS port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

value.description: List of CDN origins within an endpoint

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

CustomDomain.description: CDN CustomDomain represents a mapping between a user specified domain name and a CDN endpoint. This is to use custom domain names to represent the URLs for branding purposes.

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain. Must be a domain name.

resourceState.description: Resource status of the custom domain.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning status of the custom domain.

CustomDomainParameters.description: CustomDomain properties required for custom domain creation or update.

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain. Must be a domain name.

value.description: List of CDN CustomDomains within an endpoint.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

ValidateCustomDomainInput.description: Input of the custom domain to be validated.

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain. Must be a domain name.

customDomainValidated.description: Indicates whether the custom domain is validated or not.

reason.description: The reason why the custom domain is not valid.

message.description: The message describing why the custom domain is not valid.

type.description: The type of the resource whose name is to be validated.

CheckNameAvailabilityOutput.description: Output of check name availability API.

NameAvailable.description: Indicates whether the name is available.

Reason.description: The reason why the name is not available.

Message.description: The detailed error message describing why the name is not available.

ResourceType.description: Type of CDN resource used in CheckNameAvailability.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: Profile, endpoint, etc.

operation.description: Operation type: Read, write, delete, etc.

value.description: List of CDN operations supported by the CDN resource provider.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

QueryStringCachingBehavior.description: Defines the query string caching behavior.

Sku.description: The SKU (pricing tier) of the CDN profile.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

apiVersionParameter.name: api-version
apiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. Current version is 2016-10-02

resourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
resourceGroupNameParameter.description: Name of the Resource group within the Azure subscription.
